New Records: LeBron James recorded his fourth straight triple-double with 15 points, 16 rebounds, and 12 assists.
Key Match Events: The Spurs welcomed the Lakers with a 9-0 blast in the first three minutes, forcing JJ Redick to call a timeout.
The Lakers survived the Spurs' quick start behind Anthony Davis' 16 points.
The LA Lakers turned the tables on the San Antonio Spurs in the second quarter.
The second half featured a more defensive battle between the two teams compared to the first two quarters.
Post-Match Reflections: The LA Lakers showed better execution in the fourth quarter to hold off their hard-charging opponents.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Anthony Davis poured a game-high 40 points with 12 rebounds, two blocks, and two assists.
Victor Wembanyama had 16 of his 28 points in the first half and added 14 rebounds and five assists.
Chris Paul and Stephon Castle combined for 33 points, 16 assists, and four rebounds.
Others: The LA Lakers opened their defense of the Emirates NBA Cup championship on Friday with a 120-115 win against the San Antonio Spurs.
